name: Temple Area
context: These tablets were discovered in the ruins of what appears to be a small neighborhood temple. The tablets were found buried under fallen stone blocks from the temple's outer wall. Most show signs of hurried burial, suggesting they were hidden during some kind of emergency. The clay is of higher quality than typical marketplace tablets, indicating religious significance.

texts.name: Daily Prayer Tablet
texts.notes: Found near altar remains. Carefully carved with reverent script and a crude drawing of the sun and clouds.

texts.name: Offering Record
texts.notes: Discovered in offering chamber. Formal script suggests official temple record-keeping.

texts.name: Blessing Request
texts.notes: Found buried beneath prayer mat remnants. Script shows emotional urgency in carving depth.

texts.name: Ritual Instruction
texts.notes: Located in priest's quarters. Very precise script indicating instructional text for ceremonies.

texts.name: Community Gathering
texts.notes: Found in main temple hall. Large script carved for public reading during gatherings.

texts.name: Sacred Fire Tending
texts.notes: Discovered near eternal flame pit. Heat-damaged but script shows careful maintenance notes.

texts.name: Morning Service
texts.notes: Found in dawn-facing alcove. Script worn smooth from repeated reading during sunrise prayers.
